text: over the last 48 hours or so the nato
air campaign has expanded to include
some rather high visibility targets in
Tripoli the capital of Libya this
included taking state TV off the air if
only briefly and also attacking a palace
in Tripoli that serves as a residence
for Colonel Qaddafi but it's also a
legitimate military target according to
the Alliance because there's a command
post their administrative offices for
the military as well as communication
systems the Libya state-controlled media
said this was a NATO assassination
attempt the three star commander of the
NATO mission rejected outright that
there was an assassination attempt
underway that the mandate from the
United Nations is to protect the
civilian population none of they goes by
that I don't see pro-qadhafi forces
using violence against men women and
children and the two fully carry out
that mission they have to attack
institutions in the capital the command
and control and communicate with forces
in the field how far to extend the
mandate is a subject of almost daily
discussions between the military
commanders and NATO's political leaders
there's an interesting dichotomy here
the NATO commanders are very strictly
enforcing the United Nations resolution
that calls for protecting the civilian
population but many of NATO's political
leaders have called out right for
Qadhafi to leave power so these
increased attacks may indeed be applying
pressure on Qaddafi or perhaps to
convince those around the Libyan leader
to oust him
you
